briefTitle: Culturally-Targeted COVID-19 Communication and SARS-CoV-2 Antibody Testing Evaluation and Uptake
officialTitle: Culturally-targeted Communication to Promote SARS-CoV-2 Antibody Testing in Saliva: Enabling Evaluation of Inflammatory Pathways in COVID-19 Racial Disparities

eligibilityCriteria.criteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

* African American or White, 18 or older, and enrolled in the Flint Registry

Exclusion Criteria:

* All who do not meet inclusion criteria.

primary.measure: Number (Percentage) of Participants Requested to Participate in Saliva-based SARS-CoV-2 Antibody Testing
primary.description: Number (Percentage) of participants who respond "yes" to be included in offer to participate in no cost SAR-CoV-2 salivary antibody test.
primary.timeFrame: Immediately following didactic study portion and health communication randomization on day 1.

primary.measure: Number (Percentage) of Participants Who Requested Saliva-based SARS-CoV-2 Antibody Testing Participated in the Testing.
primary.description: Number (Percentage) of participants that requested to participate in antibody testing who actually complete antibody testing.
primary.timeFrame: 8 weeks from the day of consenting to participate in the salivary-based SARS-CoV-2 antibody testing

primary.description: Submeasure of Theory of Planned Behavior Indicating extent of a favorable attitude SARS-CoV-2 towards antibody testing (Seven point Likert Rating, with higher scores indicating more favorable Attitudes).
primary.timeFrame: Immediately following didactic study portion and health communication randomization on day 1.

primary.description: Sub-measure of Theory of Planned Behavior Indicating extent to which believes other people are favorable towards SARS-CoV-2 towards antibody testing (Seven point Likert Rating, with higher scores indicating stronger Normative Beliefs).
primary.timeFrame: Immediately following didactic study portion and health communication randomization on day 1.

primary.description: Sub-measure of Theory of Planned Behavior Indicating Self Efficacy to Complete Antibody Testing (Seven point Likert Rating, with higher scores indicating greater Perceived Behavioral Control).
primary.timeFrame: Immediately following didactic study portion and health communication randomization on day 1.

primary.description: Sub-measure of Theory of Planned Behavior indicating Intentions to Complete Antibody Testing (Seven point Likert Rating, with higher scores indicating stronger screening Intentions).
primary.timeFrame: Immediately following didactic study portion and health communication randomization on day 1.

primary.description: Extent to which participants believe that racism-related factors would diminish the value of SARS-CoV-2 antibody testing for self (Seven-point Likert rating, with higher scores indicating greater Anticipatory Racism).
primary.timeFrame: Immediately following didactic study portion and health communication randomization on day 1.
